p: With the theoretical results in Section 2.1, researchers can acquire the surface profile in one feed rate. The following procedure is to establish the surface topography in the radial direction since it is the foundation of the 3D topography model. To obtain the surface topography model, the ‘trim principle’ is extensively employed in the calculation process [ 62, 63, 64, 65]. As demonstrated in Figure 6a [ 28], the blue curve is the cutting tool trace in the diamond turning process, and the height coordinate at point B in the radial direction θ should be calculated. In fact, two or more diamond tool profiles will sweep this point in the diamond turning process and therefore leave their surface profiles, which are represented as the corresponding red arcs as depicted in Figure 6b and the tool tip are at the relevant position B m and B M, respectively.
